property.name: Include in build
property.description: Select 'Yes' to include this file in the build.

property.name: Run when project is loaded
property.description: Set to yes to run the python script file when the project is loaded.

property.name: Run when project is closed
property.description: Set to yes to run the python script file when the project is closed.

property.name: Output name
property.description:
Specify the name that you want to give the output file.

If you leave this blank, then the project name will be used.

property.name: Extra defines
property.description:
Specify additional preprocessor symbols to define here. These are passed to kalasm2 using the -D command line option.

Multiple symbols can be separated with a comma.

property.name: Libraries
property.description:
Specify the libraries to be combined with the assembler code.

Multiple libraries can be separated with a comma.

property.name: DSP hardware
property.description:
Specify the method used to set the BlueCore DSP that will be targeted by the tool chain.

"Query chip" results in BlueLab automatically detecting the DSP present by detecting the BlueCore variant that is currently connected. If no BlueCore (or a BlueCore without a DSP) is connected the tool chain will refuse to build DSP applications.

Choosing a particular BlueCore Hardware will force the tool chain to build for that target BlueCore DSP.

property.name: Build Environment
property.description: Specify which toolchain to use. Kalasm3 is the latest version of the assembler, intended for targeting newer CSR products.

property.name: Bootstrap mode
property.description:
This option controls whether or not your Kalimba application loads under the control of the DSP, by using a bootstrap program. This can result in a shorter initial loading time.
Please note that this option only has an effect on BlueCore 5 chips and beyond. It has no effect on BlueCore 3 chips.

property.name: Library set
property.description: Select the library set to use, defaults to sdk
